content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron Plate Production Line (x=1-3, y=1-3.5)
Consists of:
- Two stone furnaces at positions (1.0, 1.0) and (3.0, 1.0)
- Two burner inserters at positions (1.5, 2.5) and (3.5, 2.5)
- Two wooden chests storing iron plates at positions (1.5, 3.5) and (3.5, 3.5)

### Copper Plate Production Line (x=2-4, y=7-9.5)
Consists of:
- Two stone furnaces at positions (2.0, 7.0) and (4.0, 7.0)
- Two burner inserters at positions (2.5, 8.5) and (4.5, 8.5)
- Two wooden chests storing copper plates at positions (2.5, 9.5) and (4.5, 9.5)

### Research Facility (x=6.5-12.5, y=16.5-17.5)
Consists of:
- Two labs at positions (6.5, 16.5) and (12.5, 17.5)
- Connected to power network
- Currently researching logistics technology

### Power Generation System (x=-5.5-13.5, y=26.5-35.5)
Consists of:
- Working offshore pump at position (2.5, 35.5)
- Boiler at position (7.0, 35.5)
- Steam engine at position (13.5, 35.5)
- Two pipe groups:
  - Water pipes connecting pump to boiler
  - Steam pipes connecting boiler to engine
- Extensive electricity pole network connecting power to facilities
- Non-functional offshore pump at position (-5.5, 26.5)

ERROR TIPS

### Fluid Connection Issues
- Ensure offshore pumps are properly connected to water tiles and have valid connection points
- The offshore pump at (-5.5, 26.5) has no fluid connections - verify placement near water

### Production Line Status
- Furnaces are showing "no ingredients to smelt" warnings - ensure proper input material supply
- Some inserters show "chest is full" warnings - consider adding more storage or improving item transport

### Power Network Planning
- When expanding the power network, ensure all machines requiring electricity are within connection range of power poles
- Plan power pole placement to maintain continuous coverage between power sources and consumers
